intro: Aechmea vasquezii, commonly known as the Vásquez bromeliad, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the cloud forests of Ecuador and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a central cup to collect rainwater. The plant produces striking inflorescences with vibrant flowers that range from red to orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Aechmea vasquezii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to indoor conditions.
